elements.title: Scybalium fungiforme (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that before they can be pollinated, Scybalium fungiforme flowers (example pictured) need to be forcefully peeled open by possums or tanagers?

elements.title: Zali Steggall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Zali Steggall, an independent member of the Parliament of Australia, is an Olympic skiing medallist?

elements.title: petroglyphs from western Crete (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that petroglyphs from western Crete may depict extinct Candiacervus deer from the Palaeolithic?

elements.title: Ri Jong-yol (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that North Korean child prodigy Ri Jong-yol defected to South Korea after winning silver at the 2016 International Mathematical Olympiad in Hong Kong?

elements.title: #AppleToo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after women at Apple Inc. found a 6-percent gender wage gap and spoke out against sexual harassment and discrimination in #AppleToo, a class-action lawsuit was filed in June 2024?

elements.title: Fu Wuji (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Fu Wuji's Fuhou gujin zhu includes information on a diverse range of topics, from astrological signs to the dimensions of imperial tombs?

elements.title: a protected area with no commercial fishing permitted (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ascension Island designated its entire marine territory as a protected area with no commercial fishing permitted?

elements.title: Jacob Geller (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jewish video essayist Jacob Geller cited Jewish traditions of study and scholarship as an inspiration behind his analysis of popular culture?

elements.title: 185 Montague Street (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that one critic likened the design of 185 Montague Street in New York City to the horns of Count Basie's orchestra?
